name: Grandma's French Toast
creator: Grandma Stenson
ingredients: 1 stick margarine, 1 cup brown sugar, 1 tsp cinnamon, 6 eggs, 1 1/2 cups milk, dash of salt, 12 slices of bread
directions: 1. Melt margarine in 9 x 13 pan 2. Mix the brown sugar and cinnamon with the margarine, press the mix down and cover the whole bottom of the pan with the mix 3. In a separate bowl, mix together the eggs, milk, and salt 4. place the slices of bread in stacks of 2 onto the butter sugar mix 5. Pour the egg/milk mixture on top of the bread 6. Cover overnight in the fridge. 7. Bake uncovered at 300 F for 35-45 min

name: Banana Bread
creator: Sheila Cynkar
ingredients: 1 cup sugar, 1/3 cup soft butter, 2 eggs, 1 1/2 cups mashed bananas (3-4), 1/3 cup water, 1 2/3 cup flour 1 tsp baking soda, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/4 tsp baking powder, 1/2 cup nuts (optional)
directions: 1. Mix sugar and butter 2. Beat in eggs until blended 3. Add bananas and water and beat for 30 sec 4. Stir in the remaining ingredients (except the nuts) just until moistened. 5. Stir in nuts 6. Grease an 8 inch pan and bake for 55-60 min at 350 F

name: Med. White Sauce
creator: Mom
ingredients: 2 Tbsp butter/margarine, 2 Tbsp flour, 1/4 tsp salt, 1/8 tsp pepper, 1 cup milk, 3 hard boiled eggs
directions: Makes 1 cup.  1. Melt butter in a saucepan over low heat. Blend in flour, salt and pepper. Cook over low heat, stirring until mixture is smooth and bubbly. Remove from heat. 2. Stir in milk, heat to boiling, stirring constantly 3. Boil and stir for 1 min 4.  Peel and dice hard-boiled eggs 5. Mix eggs into white sauce.

name: Zucchini Bread
creator: Kelsey's great grandmother, Elda Ross
ingredients: 3 eggs, 2 cups sugar, 1 cup oil, 3 cup flour, 2 cup grated zucchini, 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp soda, 1/4 baking powder, 3 tsp cinnamon, 1 cup chopped nuts(optional)
directions: Makes 2 loaves. 1. Prepare pans with non-stick spray 2. eggs, sugar, oil and flour until smooth 3. Mix in the remaining ingredients 4. Bake at 325 F for 1 hour
